title: Chin Chee Seong elected SME Association national president
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The SME Association of Malaysia has elected Chin Chee Seong as its national president for the 2024-2026 term at the annual general meeting.
content:
Newly elected SME Association national president Chin Chee Seong

KUALA LUMPUR: The SME Association of Malaysia has elected Chin Chee Seong as its national president for the 2024-2026 term at the annual general meeting.

Chin, who was formerly the national secretary general of the association, will be taking over the duties from acting national president Datin Dorph Peng Wen Yin.

Meanwhile, Datuk Sri Ricky Yaw Chan Choy, formerly a national vice-pre

title: Finding 'humanity' in finance
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: There is an urgent need for companies to apply the principle of "humanity" in finance, given how there is an excessive focus on profit maximisation to the detriment of stakeholders and the planet, said Securities Commission chairman Datuk Mohammad Faiz Azmi.
content:

title: MCMC assures DNS redirection will safeguard access to legitimate websites
summary: The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) has assured that its directive to internet service providers (ISPs) to redirect domain name system (DNS) traffic using third-party DNS servers back to their servers will not affect, disrupt, or block users from accessing legitimate websites.
content:
CYBERJAYA (Sept 7): The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) has assured that its directive to internet service providers (ISPs) to redirect domain name system (DNS) traffic using third-party DNS servers back to their servers will not affect, disrupt, or block users from accessing legitimate websites.

Chief network security officer Datuk Dr Mohamed Sulaiman Sultan Suhaibuddeen stated that the websites affected by this action are those that violate Malaysian law, thereby resulting in restri

title: Kluang Umno Youth chief Syed Hussien is BN candidate for Mahkota polls
summary: Kluang Umno Youth chief Syed Hussien Syed Abdullah has been picked as the Barisan Nasional (BN) candidate for the Mahkota state by-election on Sept 28.
content:
KLUANG (Sept 7): Kluang Umno Youth chief Syed Hussien Syed Abdullah has been picked as the Barisan Nasional (BN) candidate for the Mahkota state by-election on Sept 28.

The announcement was made by Johor Umno Liaison Committee chairman Datuk Onn Hafiz Ghazi during the launch of the BN Machinery and Candidate Introduction Ceremony for the by-election here on Saturday.

The Johor menteri besar said that the selection was made following discussions and mutual agreem

title: Actions by social media providers to curb crime still weak, says Fahmi
summary: Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil said the actions of social media providers in curbing criminal activities are still weak even though 21 discussions have been held between the ministry and all platforms so far.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 7): Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil said the actions of social media providers in curbing criminal activities are still weak even though 21 discussions have been held between the ministry and all platforms so far.

Fahmi, who is also the government spokesperson, said social media providers are seen as not taking the initiative to study and identify trends in criminal activities on their platforms, but are just waiting for complaints for follow-up action.

title: Sultan Nazrin calls for restoration of humanity in finance
summary: Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Shah has called for the restoration of humanity in finance, emphasising the importance of balancing economic growth with environmental stewardship and social inclusion.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 7): Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Shah has called for the restoration of humanity in finance, emphasising the importance of balancing economic growth with environmental stewardship and social inclusion.

Speaking at the 15th SC-OCIS Roundtable held at the Oxford Centre for Islamic Studies, UK, Saturday, Sultan Nazrin highlighted the critical need for financial systems to prioritise the well-being of humanity and the planet.

“Restoring humanity

title: Grafilab partners with TheGigabit to unlock the future of AI
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Grafilab, an innovator in centralised and decentralised physical infrastructure networks (CeDePIN), has partnered with Malaysian data centre provider TheGigabit to enhance graphic processing unit (GPU) accessibility and support the development of artificial general intelligence (AGI).The partnership will ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Grafilab, an innovator in centralised and decentralised physical infrastructure networks (CeDePIN), has partnered with Malaysian data centre provider TheGigabit to enhance graphic processing unit (GPU) accessibility and support the development of artificial general intelligence (AGI).

The partnership will leverage TheGigabit's robust data centre capabilities, known for their exceptional scalability, security and performance, to enhance Grafilab's peer-to-peer GPU network.

title: King happy with country's economic, trade performance
summary:
His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim, King of Malaysia, on Saturday expressed his joy over improvements in the country’s economic situation and trade performance.

His Majesty hoped that the government would continue to work to stimulate the country’s economy to create more job opportunities and increase the income and living standards of the people.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 7): His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim, King of Malaysia, on Saturday expressed his joy over improvements in the country’s economic situation and trade performance.

His Majesty hoped that the government would continue to work to stimulate the country’s economy to create more job opportunities and increase the income and living standards of the people.

summary: In a period of global uncertainty, Malaysia’s economy is demonstrating remarkable resilience and optimism. title: Social media platform needs multilingual 'content moderator' — Teo
summary: The Ministry of Communications advises that a social media platform has to have content moderators who can understand various languages, especially local languages other than English.
content:
KULAI (Sept 7): The Ministry of Communications advises that a social media platform has to have content moderators who can understand various languages, especially local languages other than English.

Deputy Minister of Communications Teo Nie Ching said it was to enable the platform to monitor and understand content uploaded by social media users that may contain incorrect and illegal content.

"It is very important for the platforms to have moderators who are flu

title: Sultan Ibrahim warns recipients of federal awards, honours against tarnishing country's image
summary: His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim, King of Malaysia, on Saturday warned that he will withdraw the federal awards, medals and honours of recipients who commit crimes, tarnish the country’s image or if punished by the courts.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 7): His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim, King of Malaysia, on Saturday warned that he will withdraw the federal awards, medals and honours of recipients who commit crimes, tarnish the country’s image or if punished by the courts.

His Majesty said they had been selected for the awards and honours and therefore, should be honest and trustworthy to the government, mind their behaviour and not be involved in corrupt activities and crime.

"If a recipient is

title: Tourism Ministry reminds people to be wary of advertisement tender offer
summary: Members of the public are advised to check the status of any suspicious advertisement tender offer or quotation with the Ministry of Tourism, Arts and Culture (Motac) or the nearest state Motac office before taking action involving financial transactions.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (Sept 7): Members of the public are advised to check the status of any suspicious advertisement tender offer or quotation with the Ministry of Tourism, Arts and Culture (Motac) or the nearest state Motac office before taking action involving financial transactions.

In a statement on Saturday, Motac reminds the public not to be easily deceived and to be alert to any fake calls or SMS received from irresponsible parties.

According to the statement, Motac

title: Anwar: Govt to continue intensifying measures to ensure nation is stable, business friendly
summary: The government will continue to intensify efforts to ensure a stable country with a conducive and business-friendly ecosystem, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 7): The government will continue to intensify efforts to ensure a stable country with a conducive and business-friendly ecosystem, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

He said the government's continuous measures to improve governance, fight corruption and focus on high-value investments are increasingly successful in creating high-income jobs for more people.

"Thank God, the country continues to be in a better position. The country's

summary:

title: MCMC addresses misinformation on DNS redirection, internet access restrictions
summary: The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) has instructed internet service providers (ISPs) to redirect Domain Name Service (DNS) traffic that uses third-party DNS servers back to their own DNS servers.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 7): The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) has instructed internet service providers (ISPs) to redirect Domain Name Service (DNS) traffic that uses third-party DNS servers back to their own DNS servers.

MCMC in a statement on Friday night said this is to ensure that users continue to benefit from the protection provided by the local ISPs' DNS servers and that malicious sites are inaccessible to Malaysians.

title: Delays in reinvestment come back to bite Malaysia Airlines
summary: Recent weeks saw Malaysia Airlines Bhd in the spotlight for multiple reasons — from reroutes to delays due to technical issues, frequency reduction in 13 routes, getting its licence validity period cut short by the regulator, and getting its engineers poached by competitors en masse.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 7): Recent weeks saw Malaysia Airlines Bhd in the spotlight for multiple reasons — from reroutes to delays due to technical issues, frequency reduction in 13 routes, getting its licence validity period cut short by the regulator, and getting its engineers poached by competitors en masse.

The national carrier took quick action to address any concerns and ensure the safety of customers, but questions were raised on the reasons behind the hiccups, whether Malaysia Airlines could have done more,

title: Wall St stocks fall as market awaits Fed to move
summary: US stocks fell on Friday, weighed down by a jobs report that showed a continued labor market slowdown but left traders uncertain about how far the Federal Reserve will go in cutting interest rates.
content:
The Dow fell 410.34 points, or 1.01%, to 40,345.41, the S&P 500 lost 94.99 points, or 1.73%, to 5,408.42 and the Nasdaq lost 436.83 points, or 2.55%, to 16,690.83.

summary: Oil prices settled 2% lower on Friday, with a big weekly loss after data US jobs data was weaker than expected in August, which outweighed price support from a delay to supply increases by Opec+ producers.
content:
Brent crude futures were down US$1.63, or 2.24%, to US$71.06 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate crude futures fell US$1.48, or 2.14%, to US$67.67.

summary: Uncertainty over the US economy's health is rippling through markets, adding fuel to an already-volatile period that has investors grappling with a shift in Federal Reserve policy, a tight US election and worries over stretched valuations.

Evidence of ebbing risk appetite showed up across markets. — Reuters

title: A class above
summary: In the world of commercial air travel, first class and business class are the standards for premium travellers. However, for high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs), private aviation is the way to go.
content:
Four Seasons Private Jet Charter 3.

IN the world of commercial air travel, first class and business class are the standards for premium travellers. However, for high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs), private aviation is the way to go.

Driven by increased wealth and pandemic concerns, the private jet industry is experiencing significant growth.

title: Getting a good price for your home
summary: It can take time to navigate the complex Malaysian real estate market, particularly when it comes to figuring out what a property is worth.
content:
It can take time to navigate the complex Malaysian real estate market, particularly when it comes to figuring out what a property is worth.

With shifting location values, shifting market trends and the intricacies of negotiations, it is not unusual for a buyer to be on tenterhooks when there is so much information flying about and smacking them in the face. It is imperative to have a firm grasp of the most important variables

title: Investing amid shifting expectations
summary: Markets have performed well so far this year with the S&P 500 hitting fresh highs and the FBM KLCI seeing double-digit returns.
content:
2900085

MARKETS have performed well so far this year with the S&P 500 hitting fresh highs and the FBM KLCI seeing double-digit returns.

Nevertheless, the early August sell-off, with the CBOE Volatility Index rising to its highest level since the Covid pandemic, suggests that the market is not without risks.

title: Yuan rides its own course
summary: In late July, growing expectations for a US Federal Reserve rate cut and a Bank of Japan rate hike triggered a large-scale unwinding of global carry trade. While Asian currencies like the Indonesian rupiah and Malaysian ringgit outperformed the US dollar in August, strengthening by almost 5%, the yuan lagged behind, gaining only about 1.2%.
content:
China’s reluctance to pursue yuan appreciation may be strategic.

IN late July, growing expectations for a US Federal Reserve rate cut and a Bank of Japan rate hike triggered a large-scale unwinding of global carry trade. While Asian currencies like the Indonesian rupiah and Malaysian ringgit outperformed the US dollar in August, strengthening by almost 5%, the yuan lagged behind, gaining only about 1.2%.

title: Laws are important to curb anti-competitive mergers
summary: Malaysia remains one of the few countries without merger control laws, and there is no assurance that this will change soon.
content:
The Malaysia Competition Commission is stymied by the absence of merger control measures.

MALAYSIA remains one of the few countries without merger control laws, and there is no assurance that this will change soon.

The government must prioritise this issue, as the country cannot afford to be held back by the absence of a basic law.

title: Conceive solutions to improve birth rates
summary: The world is changing for the worse and we’re not talking about the climate.
content:
Malaysia is set to join the ranks of an ageing nation by 2030, with the burden increasingly falling on the young.

THE world is changing for the worse and we’re not talking about the climate.

We face an existential threat to our way of life due to the declining birthrate. It is unavoidable that as people wait longer to get married, fertility is declining, resulting in fewer births.

title: Putting money on the banks
summary: Banking stocks have been on a roll this year, largely in line with how the economy has been growing.
content:
BANKING stocks have been on a roll this year, largely in line with how the economy has been growing.

With the latest gross domestic product figures reflecting the country’s strongest growth since 2022, banks have rallied to their highest in about four years.

Foreign funds, encouraged by the strong economic growth as a result of a surge in foreign direct investment, have been pouring money into local stocks.
